isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - AUXILIARY SECTION (BENCH PROCEDURE)

step1.para: Remove the output nut using a 70 mm or 2-3/4 inch socket.

note.para: To prevent the output shaft and yoke from rotating while removing the nut, shift the transmission into two gears.

step1.para: Remove the output yoke. Use the output yoke puller if necessary (Figure 33).

important.para: If the shift bar housing is still installed, the following two steps must be performed before removing the auxiliary section.

step1.para: Remove the two bolts from the range bar lock cover (Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Remove Bolts From Range Bar Lock Cover

step1.para: Rotate the lock cover counter-clockwise until the indication notch lines up with the unlock symbol, and secure the cover in position by inserting one of the bolts into the right side hole ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Figure 35. Secure Lock Cover In Place

note.para: The dowel pins may have to be driven forward and removed to assist in the removal of the auxiliary section.

step1.para: Remove the 19 bolts securing the auxiliary section to the main case (Figure 36).
Run an M10x1.5 tap into the three threaded pusher holes in the auxiliary section flange to clean paint, rust, and other debris from the holes. Oil the holes (Figure 36).

figure.caption: Figure 36. Remove Bolts Securing Auxiliary Section

step1.para: Thread three (3) bolts evenly into the three pusher holes on the auxiliary section flange to break the gasket seal.
Continue threading the bolts in until the housing is moved rearward 1/4 inch, and then remove the pusher screws.
Install an auxiliary section hanger bracket on the top of the auxiliary section and attach a chain to the hanger bracket (Figure 37).
Use the chain to support the weight of the auxiliary section and move the auxiliary section rearward until it is free of the main case (Figure 37).

figure.caption: Figure 37. Use Chain To Support Auxiliary Section
